question: As per the latest guidelines of the Union Home ministry on the extended lock-down, industries operating in which areas have been exempted?
explanation:
The Union Home ministry has recently announced a set of revised guidelines on the extended lock-down till May 3, 2020.
As per the guidelines, travel by air, rail, metro, public buses, taxis, cab aggregators will remain suspended. However, the industries operating in rural areas, outside the limits of municipal corporations and municipalities, will be exempted. The industries should maintain measures of social distancing and sanitation.
